title: Salesforce.com, Slack, Pfizer, BioNTech: What to Watch When the Stock Market Opens Today
sub_head: U.S. futures point to a pause in the stock market rally, while Pfizer and BioNTech jump pre-market on U.K. Covid-19 vaccine approval
body:
Here’s what we are watching as markets kick into gear Wednesday.
U.S. stock futures are down, suggesting that the major indexes will take a breather after climbing to record highs. Futures tied to the S&P 500 ticked down 0.3%, a day after the benchmark set its 27th closing record of the year. Contracts linked to the technology-heavy Nasdaq-100 index edged 0.5% lower. Read our full markets wrap here.
PayPal , Lyft , Microsoft and Zoom are all presenting at a Credit Suisse tech conference. Costco Wholesale reports monthly sales after the bell. Meanwhile, the Federal Reserve’s beige book report, due at 2 p.m., will contain business anecdotes across Fed districts, giving insight into how companies view the economy’s prospects.
—Shares in Pfizer rose 3% in premarket trading after the U.K. became the first Western nation to grant emergency-use authorization for the Covid-19 vaccine developed by the company and Germany’s BioNTech SE . BioNTech’s shares were up 3% pre-market.
— Salesforce.com shares fell premarket. The company confirmed Tuesday that it would buy collaboration platform provider  Slack Technologies  in a $27.7 billion transaction. Later Tuesday, the company said President and Chief Financial Officer Mark Hawkins intends to retire from his role, effective Jan. 31. Shares fell almost 7% premarket.
